7// Buffer.cpp: Implements the gl::Buffer class, representing storage of vertex and/or
8// index data. Implements GL buffer objects and related functionality.
9// [OpenGL ES 2.0.24] section 2.9 page 21.
10
11#include "libANGLE/Buffer.h"
12
13#include "libANGLE/Context.h"
14#include "libANGLE/renderer/BufferImpl.h"
15#include "libANGLE/renderer/GLImplFactory.h"
16
17namespace gl
18{
19namespace
20{
21constexpr angle::SubjectIndex kImplementationSubjectIndex = 0;
22} // anonymous namespace
23
24BufferState::BufferState()
25 : mLabel(),
26 mUsage(BufferUsage::StaticDraw),
27 mSize(0),
28 mAccessFlags(0),
29 mAccess(GL_WRITE_ONLY_OES),
30 mMapped(GL_FALSE),
31 mMapPointer(nullptr),
32 mMapOffset(0),
33 mMapLength(0),
34 mBindingCount(0),
35 mTransformFeedbackIndexedBindingCount(0),
36 mTransformFeedbackGenericBindingCount(0),
37 mImmutable(false),
38 mStorageExtUsageFlags(0)
39{}
40
41BufferState::~BufferState() {}
42
43Buffer::Buffer(rx::GLImplFactory *factory, BufferID id)
44 : RefCountObject(factory->generateSerial(), id),
45 mImpl(factory->createBuffer(mState)),
46 mImplObserver(this, kImplementationSubjectIndex)
47{
48 mImplObserver.bind(mImpl);
49}
50
51Buffer::~Buffer()
52{
53 SafeDelete(mImpl);
54}
55
56void Buffer::onDestroy(const Context *context)
57{
58 // In tests, mImpl might be null.
59 if (mImpl)
60 mImpl->destroy(context);
61}
62
63void Buffer::setLabel(const Context *context, const std::string &label)
64{
65 mState.mLabel = label;
66}
67
68const std::string &Buffer::getLabel() const
69{
70 return mState.mLabel;
71}
72
73angle::Result Buffer::bufferStorage(Context *context,
74 BufferBinding target,
75 GLsizeiptr size,
76 const void *data,
77 GLbitfield flags)
78{
79 return bufferDataImpl(context, target, data, size, BufferUsage::InvalidEnum, flags);
80}
81
82angle::Result Buffer::bufferData(Context *context,
83 BufferBinding target,
84 const void *data,
85 GLsizeiptr size,
86 BufferUsage usage)
87{
88 GLbitfield flags = (GL_MAP_READ_BIT | GL_MAP_WRITE_BIT | GL_DYNAMIC_STORAGE_BIT_EXT);
89 return bufferDataImpl(context, target, data, size, usage, flags);
90}
91
92angle::Result Buffer::bufferDataImpl(Context *context,
93 BufferBinding target,
94 const void *data,
95 GLsizeiptr size,
96 BufferUsage usage,
97 GLbitfield flags)
98{
99 const void *dataForImpl = data;
100
101 if (mState.isMapped())
102 {
103 // Per the OpenGL ES 3.0 spec, buffers are implicity unmapped when a call to
104 // BufferData happens on a mapped buffer:
105 //
106 // If any portion of the buffer object is mapped in the current context or any context
107 // current to another thread, it is as though UnmapBuffer (see section 2.10.3) is
108 // executed in each such context prior to deleting the existing data store.
109 //
110 GLboolean dontCare = GL_FALSE;
111 ANGLE_TRY(unmap(context, &dontCare));
112 }
113
114 // If we are using robust resource init, make sure the buffer starts cleared.
115 // Note: the Context is checked for nullptr because of some testing code.
116 // TODO(jmadill): Investigate lazier clearing.
117 if (context && context->getState().isRobustResourceInitEnabled() && !data && size > 0)
118 {
119 angle::MemoryBuffer *scratchBuffer = nullptr;
120 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_ALLOC(
121 context, context->getZeroFilledBuffer(static_cast<size_t>(size), &scratchBuffer));
122 dataForImpl = scratchBuffer->data();
123 }
124
125 if (mImpl->setDataWithUsageFlags(context, target, dataForImpl, size, usage, flags) ==
126 angle::Result::Stop)
127 {
128 // If setData fails, the buffer contents are undefined. Set a zero size to indicate that.
129 mIndexRangeCache.clear();
130 mState.mSize = 0;
131
132 // Notify when storage changes.
133 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged);
134
135 return angle::Result::Stop;
136 }
137
138 mIndexRangeCache.clear();
139 mState.mUsage = usage;
140 mState.mSize = size;
141 mState.mImmutable = (usage == BufferUsage::InvalidEnum);
142 mState.mStorageExtUsageFlags = flags;
143
144 // Notify when storage changes.
145 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged);
146
147 return angle::Result::Continue;
148}
149
150angle::Result Buffer::bufferSubData(const Context *context,
151 BufferBinding target,
152 const void *data,
153 GLsizeiptr size,
154 GLintptr offset)
155{
156 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->setSubData(context, target, data, size, offset));
157
158 mIndexRangeCache.invalidateRange(static_cast<unsigned int>(offset),
159 static_cast<unsigned int>(size));
160
161 // Notify when data changes.
162 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::ContentsChanged);
163
164 return angle::Result::Continue;
165}
166
167angle::Result Buffer::copyBufferSubData(const Context *context,
168 Buffer *source,
169 GLintptr sourceOffset,
170 GLintptr destOffset,
171 GLsizeiptr size)
172{
173 ANGLE_TRY(
174 mImpl->copySubData(context, source->getImplementation(), sourceOffset, destOffset, size));
175
176 mIndexRangeCache.invalidateRange(static_cast<unsigned int>(destOffset),
177 static_cast<unsigned int>(size));
178
179 // Notify when data changes.
180 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::ContentsChanged);
181
182 return angle::Result::Continue;
183}
184
185angle::Result Buffer::map(const Context *context, GLenum access)
186{
187 ASSERT(!mState.mMapped);
188
189 mState.mMapPointer = nullptr;
190 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->map(context, access, &mState.mMapPointer));
191
192 ASSERT(access == GL_WRITE_ONLY_OES);
193
194 mState.mMapped = GL_TRUE;
195 mState.mMapOffset = 0;
196 mState.mMapLength = mState.mSize;
197 mState.mAccess = access;
198 mState.mAccessFlags = GL_MAP_WRITE_BIT;
199 mIndexRangeCache.clear();
200
201 // Notify when state changes.
202 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectMapped);
203
204 return angle::Result::Continue;
205}
206
207angle::Result Buffer::mapRange(const Context *context,
208 GLintptr offset,
209 GLsizeiptr length,
210 GLbitfield access)
211{
212 ASSERT(!mState.mMapped);
213 ASSERT(offset + length <= mState.mSize);
214
215 mState.mMapPointer = nullptr;
216 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->mapRange(context, offset, length, access, &mState.mMapPointer));
217
218 mState.mMapped = GL_TRUE;
219 mState.mMapOffset = static_cast<GLint64>(offset);
220 mState.mMapLength = static_cast<GLint64>(length);
221 mState.mAccess = GL_WRITE_ONLY_OES;
222 mState.mAccessFlags = access;
223
224 // The OES_mapbuffer extension states that GL_WRITE_ONLY_OES is the only valid
225 // value for GL_BUFFER_ACCESS_OES because it was written against ES2. Since there is
226 // no update for ES3 and the GL_READ_ONLY and GL_READ_WRITE enums don't exist for ES,
227 // we cannot properly set GL_BUFFER_ACCESS_OES when glMapBufferRange is called.
228
229 if ((access & GL_MAP_WRITE_BIT) > 0)
230 {
231 mIndexRangeCache.invalidateRange(static_cast<unsigned int>(offset),
232 static_cast<unsigned int>(length));
233 }
234
235 // Notify when state changes.
236 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectMapped);
237
238 return angle::Result::Continue;
239}
240
241angle::Result Buffer::unmap(const Context *context, GLboolean *result)
242{
243 ASSERT(mState.mMapped);
244
245 *result = GL_FALSE;
246 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->unmap(context, result));
247
248 mState.mMapped = GL_FALSE;
249 mState.mMapPointer = nullptr;
250 mState.mMapOffset = 0;
251 mState.mMapLength = 0;
252 mState.mAccess = GL_WRITE_ONLY_OES;
253 mState.mAccessFlags = 0;
254
255 // Notify when data changes.
256 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectUnmapped);
257
258 return angle::Result::Continue;
259}
260
261void Buffer::onDataChanged()
262{
263 mIndexRangeCache.clear();
264
265 // Notify when data changes.
266 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::ContentsChanged);
267
268 mImpl->onDataChanged();
269}
270
271angle::Result Buffer::getIndexRange(const gl::Context *context,
272 DrawElementsType type,
273 size_t offset,
274 size_t count,
275 bool primitiveRestartEnabled,
276 IndexRange *outRange) const
277{
278 if (mIndexRangeCache.findRange(type, offset, count, primitiveRestartEnabled, outRange))
279 {
280 return angle::Result::Continue;
281 }
282
283 ANGLE_TRY(
284 mImpl->getIndexRange(context, type, offset, count, primitiveRestartEnabled, outRange));
285
286 mIndexRangeCache.addRange(type, offset, count, primitiveRestartEnabled, *outRange);
287
288 return angle::Result::Continue;
289}
290
291GLint64 Buffer::getMemorySize() const
292{
293 GLint64 implSize = mImpl->getMemorySize();
294 return implSize > 0 ? implSize : mState.mSize;
295}
296
297bool Buffer::isDoubleBoundForTransformFeedback() const
298{
299 return mState.mTransformFeedbackIndexedBindingCount > 1;
300}
301
302void Buffer::onTFBindingChanged(const Context *context, bool bound, bool indexed)
303{
304 ASSERT(bound || mState.mBindingCount > 0);
305 mState.mBindingCount += bound ? 1 : -1;
306 if (indexed)
307 {
308 ASSERT(bound || mState.mTransformFeedbackIndexedBindingCount > 0);
309 mState.mTransformFeedbackIndexedBindingCount += bound ? 1 : -1;
310
311 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::BindingChanged);
312 }
313 else
314 {
315 mState.mTransformFeedbackGenericBindingCount += bound ? 1 : -1;
316 }
317}
318
319angle::Result Buffer::getSubData(const gl::Context *context,
320 GLintptr offset,
321 GLsizeiptr size,
322 void *outData)
323{
324 return mImpl->getSubData(context, offset, size, outData);
325}
326
327void Buffer::onSubjectStateChange(angle::SubjectIndex index, angle::SubjectMessage message)
328{
329 // Pass it along!
330 ASSERT(index == kImplementationSubjectIndex);
331 ASSERT(message == angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged);
332 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged);
333}
334} // namespace gl
